Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandra L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF44.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the costs of supervision.  Court costs to be paid in full during term of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain employment, at agent's direction.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or possessors.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Gregory Simplot, without agent's prior approval.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant to have only one physician, one medical expert and only one pharmacy.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: same as prison sentence.
Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or possessors.  

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with Gregory Simplot, without agent's prior approval.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant to have only one physician, one medical expert and one pharmacy.

timeConds.notes:
Sentence to start on or before February 19, 2016 at 6:00 P.M.  Sentence to start immediately if the defendant has any probation violations.  May serve on EMP, according to jail rules and if agent approves.

State agrees with the agent's recommendation.  Imposed and stayed sentence.  30 days jail as a condition of probation.  Extended supervision conditions:   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not Assoc. with drug users and where drugs are used or sold.  No contact with G. S. unless agent approves.  CC.  Attorney Prior agrees with recommendation of probation.  Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  

Court ordered: 14CF234.  sentence withheld.  Probation 3 years.  Conditions:  I&S 3 year prison sentence. 18 mo IC 18 m ES.  

15CF44.  sentence withheld.  Probation 5 years.  Conditions:  I&S 4 year prison sentence. 2 IC 2 ES.  

1 year jail.  Start on or before February 19, 2016 at 6:00 pm.  If violate prior to that day, must start sentence immediately.  May serve on EMP, according to jail rules and her agent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA, if recommended by agent.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  One physician, one expert, one pharmacy.  Not to associate with known illegal drug users or possessors.  No contact with G.S. without agent's prior approval.  CC and supervision fees.  Pay during probation.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  o/m employment, if agent deems it appropriate.  Not eligible for CIP.  Eligible for SAP.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 09:15 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 3.  Balance of counts dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge she is pleading to.  She understands.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  She understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge.  Court found that the defendant entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  PSI ordered.  Due  11/27/15
Plea hearing at 10-12-2015 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and Attorney Prior by telephone.  Set for a plea 10/12/15 at 1:30 pm.

Status conference at 09-21-2015 03:00 pm.
same appearances.  Defendant stood mute to the charges.  NGP entered.  PTC set for 9/2/15 at STC set for 9/21/15 at 3 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  WOPH form filed with the court.  Court reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendnat knowingly and intelligently waived her right to a preliminary hearing.  Information filed with court.
Waiver of Prelim at 08-10-2015 02:30 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Prior.  Attorney Prior stated his is still waiting form discovery on 14CF234.  He received discovery this AM on 15CF44 & 46.  ADA Inlow just became aware of the issue today.  She e-mailed SO to have the discovery done by Friday.  Court told ADA Inlow to remind SO of their obligation to disclose.  STC set for 6/22/15 at 3 pm.  Attorney Prior can appear by telephone.
Status conference at 05-26-2015 03:00 pm
